bug.summary: Help! I can't eval using weight-sparse learner.
bug.description: After compress the model resnet on dataset cifar10 using weight-sparse learner, I want to evaluate the accuracy. I set --exec_mode=eval, but the result is follow: INFO:tensorflow:model files: model.ckpt-97656.data-00000-of-00001, checkpoint, model.ckpt-97656.meta, model.ckpt-97656.index INFO:tensorflow:Restoring parameters from ./models/model.ckpt-97656 INFO:tensorflow:starting 0-th roll-out INFO:tensorflow:a-loss = 0.00e+00 | c-loss = 0.00e+00 | noise std. = 1.00e+00 INFO:tensorflow:Restoring parameters from ./models_pruned/model.ckpt This is not normal．I have the folder models_ws, but it is compress again when i set --exec_model=eval. Any help and hint is appreciated.

comments.comment: Sorry, it is a bug in our implementation. We should skip the RL-based optimization process when exec_mode is set to “eval”. We will fix it ASAP. Thanks for your feedback.
